children.subject:
Not sure about access to the Piazza (I think the class access code is a new feature that wasn't around when I was on staff), but if you just want to look at old homeworks / discussions / etc, you can see old pages at [semester].eecs70.org (eg, last summer's website is at su19.eecs70.org--spring semesters use sp[year] and fall uses fa[year]).  You should also still be able to view the homework threads from the semester you took 70--you can still view posts on inactive Piazzas, you just can't make new posts or anything.

About the solutions being taken down, I understand how that can be frustrating if you want to go back and review your old work, but do keep in mind that we only take them down because those problems are often reused from semester to semester (given TA budget constraints, it's not feasible to write entirely new homeworks every semester), and having solutions floating around online tends to lead to worse learning outcomes for future students.
regarding viewing past hw and discussion solutions, I believe you can use archive.org to access them. I don't condone current CS70 students abusing this to cheat.

history.content:
It seems like I can't get into the cs70 class access code. I'm reviewing 70 stuff in order to prepare for 189, but I can access the piazza to look at discussion/homework threads. 

It's a bit frustrating that all the homework and discussion solutions of previous semesters has been taken down too.
history.subject: cs70 class access code?
